name: WP Branding Bar
version: 1.5.6 Plays nice with https, uses 3.5 media manager
author: stacyvlasits

sections.description:
WP Branding Bar creates an adjustable header bar accross the top of your site, with room for two user-defined images with two user-defined links. Provides default images and branding for sites in the utexas.edu domain.

By default the branding bar has the following characteriestics:

  • Appears on every public facing page of your site
  • Appears below the WordPress admin bar
  • White background
  • 40px tall
  • Covers the width of the viewport
  • Includes a (very ugly) left-aligned and a (very ugly) right-aligned image
  • Each image is aligned to the width of the main content div in your site
  • Each image is a link to example.com

Defaults that can be changed on the settings page

  • Height of header bar
  • Width of the div that contains the branding images
  • The branding images
  • The url the branding image points to
  • The background image of the div
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload and unzip wp-branding-bar.zip to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Add your own branding images and links on the Settings –> WP Branding Bar settings page
sections.faq:
Where do I adjust the settings

WP Admin Panel –> Settings –> WP Branding Bar
(See screenshots)
sections.changelog:
1.5.6

  • Plays nicely with https
  • Uses the 3.5 media manager

1.5.5

  • Added edittable alt text fields
  • Made the right image optional

1.5.2

  • Fixed naming conflict bug

1.5.1

  • Fixed bug affecting the default images

1.5

  • Added new default logo

1.4

  • Enabled adjusting the height of the bar

1.3

  • Enbled modification of background image and links

1.2

  • Enabled user to change the images that appear in the header.

1.1

  • Display bug fixes
